definition: Wu Yong, character of 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], nicknamed Resourceful Star 智多星[Zhi4 duo1 xing1]
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: The military counselor Wu Yong in the novel "Water Margins"is a man of ingenuity.
sentences.chinese: 小說《水滸》中的吳用在軍事上足智多謀。

sentences.english: Wu Yong is a key figure in a famous classical lifurature book named" water land".
sentences.chinese: 吳用是《水滸傳》中的線索式人物，是衆人物的靈魂。

sentences.english: Military councilor Wu Ying sent Shi Qian to attend to this matter.
sentences.chinese: 軍師吳用派施七俺出席這個問題。

definition: Pang Juan (-342 BC), military leader and political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
famous Song dynasty family of warriors (c. 10th century AD), resisted the Liao 遼|辽 and defended the Song/the subject of the popular fiction Yang Saga 楊家將|杨家将
Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
Wu Guang (died 208 BC), Qin dynasty rebel, leader of the Chen Sheng Wu Guang Uprising 陳勝吳廣起義|陈胜吴广起义[Chen2 Sheng4 Wu2 Guang3 Qi3 yi4]
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
